26 #ifndef REACTPHYSICS3D_BOX_SHAPE_H
27 #define REACTPHYSICS3D_BOX_SHAPE_H

34 namespace reactphysics3d {

40 // Class BoxShape
47 class BoxShape : public ConvexPolyhedronShape {
48 
49  protected :
50 
51  // -------------------- Attributes -------------------- //
52 
54  Vector3 mExtent;
55 
57  HalfEdgeStructure mHalfEdgeStructure;
58 
59  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
60 
62  virtual Vector3 getLocalSupportPointWithoutMargin(const Vector3& direction) const override;
63 
65  virtual bool testPointInside(const Vector3& localPoint, ProxyShape* proxyShape) const override;
66 
68  virtual bool raycast(const Ray& ray, RaycastInfo& raycastInfo, ProxyShape* proxyShape, MemoryAllocator& allocator) const override;
69 
71  virtual size_t getSizeInBytes() const override;
72 
73  public :
74 
75  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
76 
78  BoxShape(const Vector3& extent);
79 
81  virtual ~BoxShape() override = default;
82 
84  BoxShape(const BoxShape& shape) = delete;
85 
87  BoxShape& operator=(const BoxShape& shape) = delete;
88 
90  Vector3 getExtent() const;
91 
93  virtual void getLocalBounds(Vector3& min, Vector3& max) const override;
94

99  virtual uint getNbFaces() const override;

121

124

127 };
128 
129 // Return the extents of the box
133 inline Vector3 BoxShape::getExtent() const {
134  return mExtent;
135 }
136 
137 // Return the local bounds of the shape in x, y and z directions
139 
143 inline void BoxShape::getLocalBounds(Vector3& min, Vector3& max) const {
144 
145  // Maximum bounds
146  max = mExtent;
147 
148  // Minimum bounds
149  min = -max;
150 }
151 
152 // Return the number of bytes used by the collision shape
153 inline size_t BoxShape::getSizeInBytes() const {
154  return sizeof(BoxShape);
155 }
156 
157 // Return a local support point in a given direction without the object margin
158 inline Vector3 BoxShape::getLocalSupportPointWithoutMargin(const Vector3& direction) const {
159 
160  return Vector3(direction.x < decimal(0.0) ? -mExtent.x : mExtent.x,
161  direction.y < decimal(0.0) ? -mExtent.y : mExtent.y,
162  direction.z < decimal(0.0) ? -mExtent.z : mExtent.z);
163 }
164 
165 // Return true if a point is inside the collision shape
166 inline bool BoxShape::testPointInside(const Vector3& localPoint, ProxyShape* proxyShape) const {
167  return (localPoint.x < mExtent[0] && localPoint.x > -mExtent[0] &&
168  localPoint.y < mExtent[1] && localPoint.y > -mExtent[1] &&
169  localPoint.z < mExtent[2] && localPoint.z > -mExtent[2]);
170 }
171 
172 // Return the number of faces of the polyhedron
173 inline uint BoxShape::getNbFaces() const {
174  return 6;
175 }
176 
177 // Return a given face of the polyhedron
178 inline const HalfEdgeStructure::Face& BoxShape::getFace(uint faceIndex) const {
179  assert(faceIndex < mHalfEdgeStructure.getNbFaces());
180  return mHalfEdgeStructure.getFace(faceIndex);
181 }
182 
183 // Return the number of vertices of the polyhedron
184 inline uint BoxShape::getNbVertices() const {
185  return 8;
186 }
187 
188 // Return a given vertex of the polyhedron
189 inline HalfEdgeStructure::Vertex BoxShape::getVertex(uint vertexIndex) const {
190  assert(vertexIndex < getNbVertices());
191  return mHalfEdgeStructure.getVertex(vertexIndex);
192 }
193 
194 // Return the position of a given vertex
195 inline Vector3 BoxShape::getVertexPosition(uint vertexIndex) const {
196  assert(vertexIndex < getNbVertices());
197 
198  Vector3 extent = getExtent();
199 
200  switch(vertexIndex) {
201  case 0: return Vector3(-extent.x, -extent.y, extent.z);
202  case 1: return Vector3(extent.x, -extent.y, extent.z);
203  case 2: return Vector3(extent.x, extent.y, extent.z);
204  case 3: return Vector3(-extent.x, extent.y, extent.z);
205  case 4: return Vector3(-extent.x, -extent.y, -extent.z);
206  case 5: return Vector3(extent.x, -extent.y, -extent.z);
207  case 6: return Vector3(extent.x, extent.y, -extent.z);
208  case 7: return Vector3(-extent.x, extent.y, -extent.z);
209  }
210 
211  assert(false);
212  return Vector3::zero();
213 }
214 
215 // Return the normal vector of a given face of the polyhedron
216 inline Vector3 BoxShape::getFaceNormal(uint faceIndex) const {
217  assert(faceIndex < getNbFaces());
218 
219  switch(faceIndex) {
220  case 0: return Vector3(0, 0, 1);
221  case 1: return Vector3(1, 0, 0);
222  case 2: return Vector3(0, 0, -1);
223  case 3: return Vector3(-1, 0, 0);
224  case 4: return Vector3(0, -1, 0);
225  case 5: return Vector3(0, 1, 0);
226  }
227 
228  assert(false);
229  return Vector3::zero();
230 }
231 
232 // Return the centroid of the box
233 inline Vector3 BoxShape::getCentroid() const {
234  return Vector3::zero();
235 }
236 
237 // Return the string representation of the shape
238 inline std::string BoxShape::to_string() const {
239  return "BoxShape{extents=" + mExtent.to_string() + "}";
240 }
241 
242 // Return the number of half-edges of the polyhedron
243 inline uint BoxShape::getNbHalfEdges() const {
244  return 24;
245 }
246 
247 // Return a given half-edge of the polyhedron
248 inline const HalfEdgeStructure::Edge& BoxShape::getHalfEdge(uint edgeIndex) const {
249  assert(edgeIndex < getNbHalfEdges());
250  return mHalfEdgeStructure.getHalfEdge(edgeIndex);
251 }
252 
253 }
254 
255 #endif
